text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that goods from third countries to Northern Ireland, if it can be proven that the goods are intended to remain in Northern Ireland, are only subject to the UK tariff rate. The candidate answer states under the 'Burden of Proof' section: 'From Third Countries (e.g., China to NI): ... Direct import to NI: UK customs clearance first (NI as UK frontier). If no EU destination proof, green lane...' and later confirms that green lane goods are subject to UK rules/tariffs. Specifically, it mentions that goods pay UK duties unless for NI consumption (proof required). This aligns with the requirement that if the destination is proven to be NI (UK market), only the UK tariff applies.", "criterion_id": "31ba07bc-6e8b-4a21-b24c-b747c1641530"}
